summary.long: Galatians is a book of the New Testament.

verses.text: Paul, an apostle, (not of men, neither by man, but by Jesus Christ, and God the Father, who raised him from the dead;)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all the brethren which are with me, unto the churches of Galatia:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Grace be to you and peace from God the Father, and from our Lord Jesus Christ,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who gave himself for our sins, that he might deliver us from this present evil world, according to the will of God and our Father:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To whom be glory for ever and ever. Amen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I marvel that ye are so soon removed from him that called you into the grace of Christ unto another gospel:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Which is not another; but there be some that trouble you, and would pervert the gospel of Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But though we, or an angel from heaven, preach any other gospel unto you than that which we have preached unto you, let him be accursed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As we said before, so say I now again, If any man preach any other gospel unto you than that ye have received, let him be accursed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For do I now persuade men, or God? or do I seek to please men? for if I yet pleased men, I should not be the servant of Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I certify you, brethren, that the gospel which was preached of me is not after man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I neither received it of man, neither was I taught it, but by the revelation of Jesus Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For ye have heard of my conversation in time past in the Jews’ religion, how that beyond measure I persecuted the church of God, and wasted it:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And profited in the Jews’ religion above many my equals in mine own nation, being more exceedingly zealous of the traditions of my fathers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when it pleased God, who separated me from my mother’s womb, and called me by his grace,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To reveal his Son in me, that I might preach him among the heathen; immediately I conferred not with flesh and blood:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Neither went I up to Jerusalem to them which were apostles before me; but I went into Arabia, and returned again unto Damascus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then after three years I went up to Jerusalem to see Peter, and abode with him fifteen days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But other of the apostles saw I none, save James the Lord’s brother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the things which I write unto you, behold, before God, I lie not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Afterwards I came into the regions of Syria and Cilicia;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And was unknown by face unto the churches of Judaea which were in Christ:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they had heard only, That he which persecuted us in times past now preacheth the faith which once he destroyed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they glorified God in me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then fourteen years after I went up again to Jerusalem with Barnabas, and took Titus with me also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I went up by revelation, and communicated unto them that gospel which I preach among the Gentiles, but privately to them which were of reputation, lest by any means I should run, or had run, in vain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But neither Titus, who was with me, being a Greek, was compelled to be circumcised:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And that because of false brethren unawares brought in, who came in privily to spy out our liberty which we have in Christ Jesus, that they might bring us into bondage:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To whom we gave place by subjection, no, not for an hour; that the truth of the gospel might continue with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But of these who seemed to be somewhat, (whatsoever they were, it maketh no matter to me: God accepteth no man’s person:) for they who seemed to be somewhat in conference added nothing to me:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But contrariwise, when they saw that the gospel of the uncircumcision was committed unto me, as the gospel of the circumcision was unto Peter;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (For he that wrought effectually in Peter to the apostleship of the circumcision, the same was mighty in me toward the Gentiles:)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when James, Cephas, and John, who seemed to be pillars, perceived the grace that was given unto me, they gave to me and Barnabas the right hands of fellowship; that we should go unto the heathen, and they unto the circumcision.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Only they would that we should remember the poor; the same which I also was forward to do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when Peter was come to Antioch, I withstood him to the face, because he was to be blamed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For before that certain came from James, he did eat with the Gentiles: but when they were come, he withdrew and separated himself, fearing them which were of the circumcision.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the other Jews dissembled likewise with him; insomuch that Barnabas also was carried away with their dissimulation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when I saw that they walked not uprightly according to the truth of the gospel, I said unto Peter before them all, If thou, being a Jew, livest after the manner of Gentiles, and not as do the Jews, why compellest thou the Gentiles to live as do the Jews?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We who are Jews by nature, and not sinners of the Gentiles,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Knowing that a man is not justified by the works of the law, but by the faith of Jesus Christ, even we have believed in Jesus Christ, that we might be justified by the faith of Christ, and not by the works of the law: for by the works of the law shall no flesh be justified.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if, while we seek to be justified by Christ, we ourselves also are found sinners, is therefore Christ the minister of sin? God forbid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if I build again the things which I destroyed, I make myself a transgressor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I through the law am dead to the law, that I might live unto God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am crucified with Christ: nevertheless I live; yet not I, but Christ liveth in me: and the life which I now live in the flesh I live by the faith of the Son of God, who loved me, and gave himself for me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I do not frustrate the grace of God: for if righteousness come by the law, then Christ is dead in vain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: O foolish Galatians, who hath bewitched you, that ye should not obey the truth, before whose eyes Jesus Christ hath been evidently set forth, crucified among you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This only would I learn of you, Received ye the Spirit by the works of the law, or by the hearing of faith?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Are ye so foolish? having begun in the Spirit, are ye now made perfect by the flesh?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Have ye suffered so many things in vain? if it be yet in vain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He therefore that ministereth to you the Spirit, and worketh miracles among you, doeth he it by the works of the law, or by the hearing of faith?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even as Abraham believed God, and it was accounted to him for righteousness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Know ye therefore that they which are of faith, the same are the children of Abraham.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the scripture, foreseeing that God would justify the heathen through faith, preached before the gospel unto Abraham, saying, In thee shall all nations be blessed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So then they which be of faith are blessed with faithful Abraham.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For as many as are of the works of the law are under the curse: for it is written, Cursed is every one that continueth not in all things which are written in the book of the law to do them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But that no man is justified by the law in the sight of God, it is evident: for, The just shall live by faith.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the law is not of faith: but, The man that doeth them shall live in them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Christ hath redeemed us from the curse of the law, being made a curse for us: for it is written, Cursed is every one that hangeth on a tree:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That the blessing of Abraham might come on the Gentiles through Jesus Christ; that we might receive the promise of the Spirit through faith.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Brethren, I speak after the manner of men; Though it be but a man’s covenant, yet if it be confirmed, no man disannulleth, or addeth thereto.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now to Abraham and his seed were the promises made. He saith not, And to seeds, as of many; but as of one, And to thy seed, which is Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And this I say, that the covenant, that was confirmed before of God in Christ, the law, which was four hundred and thirty years after, cannot disannul, that it should make the promise of none effect.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if the inheritance be of the law, it is no more of promise: but God gave it to Abraham by promise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wherefore then serveth the law? It was added because of transgressions, till the seed should come to whom the promise was made; and it was ordained by angels in the hand of a mediator.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now a mediator is not a mediator of one, but God is one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Is the law then against the promises of God? God forbid: for if there had been a law given which could have given life, verily righteousness should have been by the law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the scripture hath concluded all under sin, that the promise by faith of Jesus Christ might be given to them that believe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But before faith came, we were kept under the law, shut up unto the faith which should afterwards be revealed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wherefore the law was our schoolmaster to bring us unto Christ, that we might be justified by faith.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But after that faith is come, we are no longer under a schoolmaster.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For ye are all the children of God by faith in Christ Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For as many of you as have been baptized into Christ have put on Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There is neither Jew nor Greek, there is neither bond nor free, there is neither male nor female: for ye are all one in Christ Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if ye be Christ’s, then are ye Abraham’s seed, and heirs according to the promise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now I say, That the heir, as long as he is a child, differeth nothing from a servant, though he be lord of all;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But is under tutors and governors until the time appointed of the father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even so we, when we were children, were in bondage under the elements of the world:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the fulness of the time was come, God sent forth his Son, made of a woman, made under the law,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To redeem them that were under the law, that we might receive the adoption of sons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And because ye are sons, God hath sent forth the Spirit of his Son into your hearts, crying, Abba, Father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wherefore thou art no more a servant, but a son; and if a son, then an heir of God through Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Howbeit then, when ye knew not God, ye did service unto them which by nature are no gods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But now, after that ye have known God, or rather are known of God, how turn ye again to the weak and beggarly elements, whereunto ye desire again to be in bondage?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ye observe days, and months, and times, and years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am afraid of you, lest I have bestowed upon you labour in vain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Brethren, I beseech you, be as I am; for I am as ye are: ye have not injured me at all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ye know how through infirmity of the flesh I preached the gospel unto you at the first.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And my temptation which was in my flesh ye despised not, nor rejected; but received me as an angel of God, even as Christ Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Where is then the blessedness ye spake of? for I bear you record, that, if it had been possible, ye would have plucked out your own eyes, and have given them to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Am I therefore become your enemy, because I tell you the truth?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They zealously affect you, but not well; yea, they would exclude you, that ye might affect them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But it is good to be zealously affected always in a good thing, and not only when I am present with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My little children, of whom I travail in birth again until Christ be formed in you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I desire to be present with you now, and to change my voice; for I stand in doubt of you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Tell me, ye that desire to be under the law, do ye not hear the law?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For it is written, that Abraham had two sons, the one by a bondmaid, the other by a freewoman.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he who was of the bondwoman was born after the flesh; but he of the freewoman was by promise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Which things are an allegory: for these are the two covenants; the one from the mount Sinai, which gendereth to bondage, which is Agar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this Agar is mount Sinai in Arabia, and answereth to Jerusalem which now is, and is in bondage with her children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jerusalem which is above is free, which is the mother of us all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For it is written, Rejoice, thou barren that bearest not; break forth and cry, thou that travailest not: for the desolate hath many more children than she which hath an husband.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now we, brethren, as Isaac was, are the children of promise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But as then he that was born after the flesh persecuted him that was born after the Spirit, even so it is now.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nevertheless what saith the scripture? Cast out the bondwoman and her son: for the son of the bondwoman shall not be heir with the son of the freewoman.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So then, brethren, we are not children of the bondwoman, but of the free.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Stand fast therefore in the liberty wherewith Christ hath made us free, and be not entangled again with the yoke of bondage.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, I Paul say unto you, that if ye be circumcised, Christ shall profit you nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I testify again to every man that is circumcised, that he is a debtor to do the whole law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Christ is become of no effect unto you, whosoever of you are justified by the law; ye are fallen from grace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For we through the Spirit wait for the hope of righteousness by faith.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For in Jesus Christ neither circumcision availeth any thing, nor uncircumcision; but faith which worketh by love.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ye did run well; who did hinder you that ye should not obey the truth?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This persuasion cometh not of him that calleth you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A little leaven leaveneth the whole lump.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have confidence in you through the Lord, that ye will be none otherwise minded: but he that troubleth you shall bear his judgment, whosoever he be.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I, brethren, if I yet preach circumcision, why do I yet suffer persecution? then is the offence of the cross ceased.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I would they were even cut off which trouble you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For, brethren, ye have been called unto liberty; only use not liberty for an occasion to the flesh, but by love serve one another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For all the law is fulfilled in one word, even in this; Thou shalt love thy neighbour as thyself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if ye bite and devour one another, take heed that ye be not consumed one of another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This I say then, Walk in the Spirit, and ye shall not fulfil the lust of the flesh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the flesh lusteth against the Spirit, and the Spirit against the flesh: and these are contrary the one to the other: so that ye cannot do the things that ye would.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if ye be led of the Spirit, ye are not under the law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the works of the flesh are manifest, which are these; Adultery, fornication, uncleanness, lasciviousness,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Idolatry, witchcraft, hatred, variance, emulations, wrath, strife, seditions, heresies,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Envyings, murders, drunkenness, revellings, and such like: of the which I tell you before, as I have also told you in time past, that they which do such things shall not inherit the kingdom of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the fruit of the Spirit is love, joy, peace, longsuffering, gentleness, goodness, faith,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Meekness, temperance: against such there is no law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they that are Christ’s have crucified the flesh with the affections and lusts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If we live in the Spirit, let us also walk in the Spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let us not be desirous of vain glory, provoking one another, envying one another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Brethren, if a man be overtaken in a fault, ye which are spiritual, restore such an one in the spirit of meekness; considering thyself, lest thou also be tempted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Bear ye one another’s burdens, and so fulfil the law of Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if a man think himself to be something, when he is nothing, he deceiveth himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But let every man prove his own work, and then shall he have rejoicing in himself alone, and not in another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For every man shall bear his own burden.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let him that is taught in the word communicate unto him that teacheth in all good things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be not deceived; God is not mocked: for whatsoever a man soweth, that shall he also reap.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he that soweth to his flesh shall of the flesh reap corruption; but he that soweth to the Spirit shall of the Spirit reap life everlasting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And let us not be weary in well doing: for in due season we shall reap, if we faint not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As we have therefore opportunity, let us do good unto all men, especially unto them who are of the household of faith.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ye see how large a letter I have written unto you with mine own hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As many as desire to make a fair shew in the flesh, they constrain you to be circumcised; only lest they should suffer persecution for the cross of Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For neither they themselves who are circumcised keep the law; but desire to have you circumcised, that they may glory in your flesh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But God forbid that I should glory, save in the cross of our Lord Jesus Christ, by whom the world is crucified unto me, and I unto the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For in Christ Jesus neither circumcision availeth any thing, nor uncircumcision, but a new creature.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as many as walk according to this rule, peace be on them, and mercy, and upon the Israel of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From henceforth let no man trouble me: for I bear in my body the marks of the Lord Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Brethren, the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit. Amen.
verses.speaker: Narrator
